references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduced latent diffusion models (LDMs) for image synthesis, which is the foundation for many state-of-the-art image generation models, including Stable Diffusion and SDXL, both of which are heavily referenced and utilized in the current paper.

references.paper_title: SDXL: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces SDXL, a state-of-the-art text-to-image diffusion model that builds upon the LDM framework and is central to the current paper's focus on extending its resolution capabilities.

references.paper_title: VideoCrafter2: Overcoming data limitations for high-quality video diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces VideoCrafter2, a cutting-edge video diffusion model used as a core component for the video generation aspect of the proposed FreeScale method.

references.paper_title: ScaleCrafter: Tuning-free higher-resolution visual generation with diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces ScaleCrafter, a tuning-free method that directly influences the core idea of FreeScale and serves as a primary baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: DemoFusion: Democratising high-resolution image generation with no $$$
references.reason: This paper presents DemoFusion, another key baseline model and methodological inspiration for FreeScale, particularly regarding the concept of fusing patches for enhanced image generation.
